SUMMARY: The Michigan State University Museum traveling exhibit, Pat-Riots to Patriots: American Irish in caricature and comic art, a collection of images assembled by John and Selma Appel, depicts the stereotyping of the Irish in Britain and the United States during the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries.
Includes bibliographical references. 1. Irish Americans
Caricatures and cartoons

126.author: story and art by Rumiko Takahashi.

(One-Pound Gospel)

"Although he's constantly waging war against his appetite, pro boxer Kosaku never met a meal he didn't like! Naturally, this plays havoc with his weight class. Can the faith of a pretty novice nun Sister Angela redeem the gluttonous appetite of the tempted lamb astride the scale?"
"This volume contains the One-Pound Gospel installments from Animerica vol. 3, no. 10 through vol. 4, no. 1 and the One Pound Gospel series monthly series #1 through #4 in their entirety."
